content: enough clearance to open the front and rear covers results in extended service times or outages. Figure 11-8 Maximum service clearance area (four frames) For more information, see IBM 3931 Installation Manual for Physical Planning, GC28-7015. 468 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide 11.5 Energy management This section describes the elements of energy management to help you understand the requirements for power and cooling, monitoring and trending, and reducing power consumption. The energy management structure for the server is shown in Figure 11-9. Figure 11-9 IBM z16 Energy Management The hardware components in the IBM z16 are monitored and managed by the energy management component in the Support Element (SE) and HMC. The graphical user interfaces (GUIs) of the SE and HMC provide views, such as the Monitors Dashboard, Environmental Efficiency Statistics, and Energy Optimization Advisor. The following tools are available to plan and monitor the energy consumption of IBM z16 servers: 
